entry.title: Lucy de László (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that portraits of Lucy de László with a violin (one portrait pictured), painted by her husband, are recognised as some of the first examples of portraiture to include womens' talents in them?

entry.title: Beautiful Country (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that civil rights lawyer Qian Julie Wang wrote the draft of her memoir Beautiful Country on her phone during her commute?

entry.title: Jennie Scott Griffiths (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the memorabilia of Jennie Scott Griffiths, a Texan who died in California, are housed in the National Library of Australia?

entry.title: The Laines (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Queen Camilla has said that her childhood at The Laines was "perfect in every way"?

entry.title: Utica College radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite a "No Rock & Roll" sign in the studios of the Utica College radio station, students played it anyway?

entry.title: "Pinkie" Jackson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kenyan coffee farmer "Pinkie" Jackson amassed Africa's largest collection of native butterflies?

entry.title: Vilna Soviet of Workers Deputies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that following a gun battle with Polish legionnaires, five leaders of the Vilna Soviet of Workers Deputies committed suicide rather than surrendering?

entry.title: Empire Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Abbott and Costello dragged the Empire Theatre 168 feet (51 m) in 1998?
